block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items should be submitted by mail at least three weeks in advance to New Jersey Cultural Calendar, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
THEATER

CHATHAM ''Pippin,'' by Stephen Schwartz. Through May 20. Tickets: $18 and $25. Chatham Community Players, 23 North Passaic Avenue. (973) 635-7363. CINNAMINSON ''Into the Woods,'' by Stephen Sondheim; Burlington County Footlighters. Through May 20. Tickets: $15. The Playhouse, 808 Pomona Road. (856) 829-7144. FREEHOLD ''Men Are Dogs,'' by Joe Simonelli. Through June 11. Tickets: $22 and $24. Center Playhouse, 35 South Street. (732) 462-9093. MAPLEWOOD ''The Tale of the Allergist's Wife,'' comedy by Charles Busch; the Strollers. Friday through May 19. Tickets: $13 and $16. Burgdorff Cultural Center, 10 Durand Road. (973) 761-8453. MILLBURN ''Midsummer Night's Dream.'' Through May 21. $19 to $68. Paper Mill Playhouse, Brookside Drive. (973) 376-4343. MONTCLAIR ''Pinocchio,'' Running Rabbit Family Theater. Through May 26. Tickets: $14. Luna Stage, 695 Bloomfield Avenue. (973) 744-3309. NEW BRUNSWICK ''The Will Rogers Follies,'' musical by Cy Coleman, Peter Stone, Betty Comden and Adolph Green. Friday and May 13. Tickets: $30 to $55. State Theater, 15 Livingston Avenue. (732) 246-7469. ORADELL ''Proof,'' by David Auburn; Bergen County Players. Through May 27. Tickets: $15. Little Firehouse Theater, 298 Kinderkamack Road. (201) 261-4200. PRINCETON ''Ridiculous Fraud,'' comedy by Beth Henley. Friday through June 11. Tickets: $35 to $48. McCarter Theater Center, 91 University Place. (609) 258-2787. RANDOLPH ''The Heidi Chronicles'' by Wendy Wasserstein. Through May 13. Tickets: $12 and $15. Brundage Park Playhouse, Carrell Road. (973) 989-7092. RED BANK ''What the Butler Saw,'' farce by Joe Orton. Thursday through May 28. Tickets: $25 to $45. Two River Theater, 21 Bridge Avenue. (732) 345-1400. RUTHERFORD ''Wizard of Oz,'' Happy Times Children's Theater. May 13 at 1 and 3 p.m. Tickets: $7; reservations recommended. Williams Center for the Arts, 1 Williams Plaza. (201) 939-2323. SUSSEX ''Handicapping,'' staged reading of the play by James McLindon; Tri-State Actors Theater. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Donation. Crescent Theater, Fountain Square at Main Street. (973) 875-2950. TEANECK ''Summer of Love,'' musical featuring hit songs of 1967; Garage Theater Group. Through May 24. Tickets: $20 to $30. Fairleigh Dickinson University, Becton Theater, 960 River Road. (201) 569-7710. UPPER MONTCLAIR ''One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest,'' drama by Dale Wasserman, based on the novel by Ken Kesey. Through May 13. Tickets: $15. Studio Players, 14 Alvin Place. (973) 744-9752. WESTFIELD ''Nunsense,'' by Dan Goggin. Through May 20. Tickets: $20. Westfield Community Players, 1000 North Avenue West. (908) 232-1221. WEST WINDSOR ''La Cage aux Folles,'' by Jerry Herman and Harvey Fierstein; Pierrot Productions. Friday through May 21. Tickets: $10 and $16. Mercer County Community College, Kelsey Theater, 1200 Old Trenton Road. (609) 584-9444.
MUSIC AND DANCE

ENGLEWOOD Neil Sedaka. Thursday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10 to $80. Edgar Winter. May 13 at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10 to $50. The Spinners. May 14 at 7 p.m. Tickets: $10 to $50. Bergen Performing Arts Center, 30 North Van Brunt Street. (201) 227-1030. JERSEY CITY ''A Night of Goddess Dance.'' May 13 at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15. Kennedy Dancers Repertory Center, 79 Central Avenue. (201) 659-2190. LAKE HOPATCONG Dave Stryker Organ Trio. Pavinci Italian Grill, 453 River Styx Road. (973) 770-4700. MADISON Piano Concerto No. 3 (Contradances) and other works by Beethoven; Paul Zeigler, piano. May 14 at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15 and $18. Grace Episcopal Church, Main Street at Kings Road. (973) 366-8922. MIDLAND PARK ''Happy Birthday Wolfgang!,'' Coronation Mass and other works by Mozart; Westfield Symphony and Pro Arte Chorale. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $5 to $20. Church of the Nativity, 315 Prospect Street. (201) 445-9052. MORRISTOWN Gaelic Storm, Celtic. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $32 to $37. Community Theater, 100 South Street. (973) 539-8008. NEWARK Barber's overture to ''The School For Scandal'' and other works; New Jersey Symphony Orchestra. May 13 and 16 at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $75. (800) 255-3476. ''Wachovia Jazz for Teens Concert,'' featuring 64 teenage performers. May 13 at 2 p.m. Tickets: $8 and $13. Paquito D'Rivera. May 14 at 3 p.m. Tickets: $37. New Jersey Performing Arts Center, 1 Center Street. (888) 466-5722. NEW BRUNSWICK Aretha Franklin. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $35 to $110. State Theater, 15 Livingston Avenue. (732) 246-7469. NEW BRUNSWICK Sunday Vespers Recital Series: Brian Harlow. May 14 at 6:30 p.m., following choral vespers at 6 p.m. Free. Christ Church, 5 Paterson Street. (732) 545-6262. PARAMUS ''Barrel of Dances,'' Bergen DanceMakers. May 13 at 3 p.m. Tickets: $6 and $9. ''Connections,'' Bergen DanceMakers. May 13 at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $18 and $20. Anna Maria Ciccone Theater, Bergen Community College, 400 Paramus Road. (201) 447-7428. PITTSTOWN Raritan River Music Festival: Newman and Oltman, guitar duo, with the Daedelus String Quartet. May 13 at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $12 to $23. Bethlehem Presbyterian Church. (908) 213-1100. POMONA ''Spice of Life,'' Bay-Atlantic Symphony. May 14 at 4 p.m., following conductor's talk at 3 p.m. Tickets: $21. Stockton Performing Arts Center, Jim Leeds Road. (609) 652-9000. RAHWAY Jazz Series: Bucky Pizzarelli, guitar. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $14 and $16. Arts Guild of Rahway, 1670 Irving Street. (732) 381-7511. SOUTH ORANGE Jazz at the Baird: Stein Brothers Quintet. May 13 at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15 and $17. Baird Center, 5 Mead Street. (973) 378-7754. SUMMIT Overture to Mozart's ''Marriage of Figaro'' and other works; Summit Symphony. May 13 at 8 p.m. Free. High school, Kent Place Boulevard, Summit. (201) 445-1292. TEANECK J-Team, jazz ensemble. Friday at 8 p.m. Donation: $5. Puffin Cultural Forum, 20 East Oakdene Avenue. (201) 836-8923. TRENTON Barber's overture to ''The School For Scandal'' and other works; New Jersey Symphony Orchestra. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $75. Patriots Theater, War Memorial, Memorial Drive. (800) 255-3476. WATCHUNG Ed Metz and Keith Ingham. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $13. Watchung Arts Center, 18 Stirling Road (on the Circle). (908) 753-0190. WESTFIELD ''Mozart and Mother's Day,'' Coronation Mass and other works; Westfield Symphony Orchestra with Pro Arte Chorale. May 13 at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 to $60. Presbyterian church, 140 Mountain Avenue. (908) 232-9400. WEST LONG BRANCH Elena Urioste, violin, and Hugh Sung, piano. Friday at 1 p.m. Tickets: $22. (732) 571-3526. Orchestra of St. Peter by the Sea. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $30. Monmouth University, Pollak Theater, 400 Cedar Avenue. (732) 571-3484.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

ATLANTIC CITY ''Open Ended: Abstract Watercolors by Joe Lugara.'' Through May 31. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Art center, New Jersey Avenue and the Boardwalk. (609) 347-5837. CAPE MAY ''Feeling of Community: Segregation and Education on Cape Island,'' an exploration of Cape May's African-American schools. Through May 14. Admission: $1 to $2. Mid-Atlantic Center for the Arts, Carriage House Gallery, Emlen Physick Estate, 1048 Washington Street. (609) 884-5404. CHATHAM Paintings by Joe Lugara. Through May 31. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 9:30 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Fridays, until 6 p.m.; Saturdays, until 5 p.m.; Sundays, 2 to 5 p.m. Library of the Chathams, 214 Main Street. (973) 635-0603. CLINTON Phi Theta Kappa of Raritan Valley Community College art show. May 13, 4 to 11 p.m. Admission: $8 and $10. Community center, Halstead Street. (908) 575-9458. CLINTON ''Bennett Bean: Influences and Objects,'' mixed-media works. ''Ilene Sunshine: Mediating the Void,'' site-specific installation and works on paper. Both through June 4. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Donation: $3. Hunterdon Museum of Art, 7 Lower Center Street. (908) 735-8415. CLINTON ''Dollhouse Magic: 100 Years of Miniature Homes.'' Through October 31. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Admission: $5 to $7; members, free. Red Mill Museum Village, 56 Main Street. (908) 735-4101. COLLINGSWOOD ''A Realist's View.'' Through May 13. Closing reception: May 13, 6 to 9 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays and Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 2 p.m.; Saturdays, by appointment. Perkins Center for the Arts, 30 Irvin Avenue. (856) 235-6488. FORT LEE ''Womenswork 2006,'' film, video and photo-based works by members of the Womenswork media artist collective. Through June 30. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Free. Fort Lee Historical Museum, 1588 Palisade Avenue. (201) 200-3414. HAMILTON ''Driven: Kinetic Sculpture,'' works by Jeff Kahn and Rein Triefeldt. Through July 15. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. Admission: $1 to $12; members, free. Grounds for Sculpture, Fairgrounds Road. (609) 586-0616. HAZLET TOWNSHIP Works by members of the Brush and Palette Art Guild of Keyport. Through July 3. Hours: Mondays and Wednesdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Fridays, 1 to 5 p.m. Monmouth County Library, 251 Middle Road. (732) 264-7164. HOBOKEN ''100 Hoboken Firsts.'' Through July 2. Hours: Tuesdays through Thursdays, 2 to 9 p.m.; Fridays, 1 to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Admission: $2; members, free. Historical Museum, 1301 Hudson Street. (201) 656-2240. HOPEWELL ''My Personal View of Mount Desert Island,'' photographs by Tasha O'Neill. ''Buzzing Burgundy,'' photographs by Marty Schwartz. Both through May 28. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Gallery 14, 14 Mercer Street. (609) 333-8511. JERSEY CITY ''Prima Ballerina,'' works by Mark Dagley. Through June 5. Hours by appointment. Abaton Garage, 100 Gifford Avenue. Information: www.abatongarage.com. JERSEY CITY ''15 Images, Mekong River,'' photographs by Ken Browar. Through June 24. Hours: Fridays and Saturdays, noon to 5 p.m. Cooke Contemporary, 125 1st Street. (201) 222-1358. JERSEY CITY ''Jersey City Interprets.'' Through Aug. 8. ''Surveillance,'' works by Mauro Altamura, Melanie Baker and others. ''Sophie Rivera: Portraits.'' ''Guest Artist to the Permanent Collection: Curt Ikens.'' ''Farsad Labbauf: The Zip Tie Project.'' All through Aug. 20. ''Hudson County Diary,'' short films and video works by students and alumni. Through Aug. 20. Hours: Wednesdays and Fridays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays, 11 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Admission: $2 to $4; members and children 12 and under, free; free for everyone on Thursdays, 5 to 8 p.m. Jersey City Museum, 250 Montgomery Street. (201) 200-3414. JERSEY CITY ''Tibet: A New Reality,'' photographs by Lisa Quiñones. Thursday through June 30. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. The Studio, 196 Morgan Street, third floor. (201) 946-2434. KEYPORT ''Covering/Uncovering,'' works by Lisa Ficarelli-Halpern. Through May 21. Hours: Thursdays, 5 to 7 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Mitchell Sanborn Gallery, 46 Key Front Street. (732) 888-0048. LAKE HOPATCONG ''Passage to Progress: The Morris Canal and the Transformation of Lake Hopatcong.'' Permanent. Hours: Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Free. Historical Museum, Hopatcong State Park, off Route 80 West at Exit 28 in Landing. (973) 398-2616. LAMBERTVILLE Mixed-media works by Ken Buhler, Camille Laoang and others. Through June 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sundays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Sally French Gallery, 35 North Union Street. (609) 773-0048. LAMBERTVILLE ''The Mix,'' works by Hillary Reehl, Nancy Shill and Stacie Speer Scott. Through May 29. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Pellegrino/Shill Art Gallery, 204 North Union Street. (609) 397-2889. LAYTON ''International Fiber Biennial.'' May 13 through June 4. Peters Valley Craft Center, 19 Kuhn Road. Hours: Thursdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. (973) 948-0011. LITTLE FALLS ''Heart of The Game: The Baseball Artwork of Andy Jurinko.'' Through June 1. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Admission: $4 and $6; members and children under 5, free. Yogi Berra Museum and Learning Center, Montclair State University, 8 Quarry Road. (973) 655-2378. MADISON ''Designing Tools: Form and Function.'' Through June 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Admission: $3 and $5; members and children under age 6, free. Museum of Early Trades and Crafts, 9 Main Street. (973) 377-2982, extension 12. MAHWAH ''Collection Glimpse,'' color stripe paintings by A. M. Coppenrath. Through June 16. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 8 a.m. to midnight; Fridays, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to midnight. Ramapo College, Potter Library. (201) 684-7147. MANALAPAN Paintings by members of the Circle of Friends Group. Works by members of the Garden State Marquetry Society. Both through May 30. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Monmouth County Library, 125 Symmes Drive. (732) 431-7222. MAPLEWOOD Works based on mythical gods and goddesses by Kathleen Veronesi. Through July 1. Reception: Thursday, 7:30 to 10 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Thursdays, noon to 8 p.m. Classic Design Framing, 168 Maplewood Avenue. (973) 762-5588. MARLBORO Photographs by Mary Carol Stunkel. Through May 24. Hours: Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Wednesdays, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Fridays, 1 to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monmouth County Library. 1 Library Court at Wyncrest Drive. (732) 536-9406. MILLVILLE ''2006 Fellows,'' exhibition and sale of works by Creative Glass Center of America Fellowship recipients. Through June 11. ''The Fires Burn On: 200 Years of Glassmaking in Millville.'' Through Dec. 31. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $7 to $10; children ages 5 and under, free. Museum of American Glass, Gallery of Fine Craft, Wheaton Village, 1501 Glasstown Road. (800) 998-4552. MILLVILLE ''Artigianato Popolare: Italian Folk Arts and Crafts.'' Friday through Dec. 31. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Additional hours: Saturdays, 10 a.m. to noon. Admission: $7 to $10; children 5 and under, free. Down Jersey Folklife Center, Wheaton Village, 1501 Glasstown Road. (800) 998-4552. MONTCLAIR ''Anxious Objects: Willie Cole's Favorite Bands.'' ''African-American Works From the Collection.'' Both through Aug. 6. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Museum admission: $6 to $8; free for members and age 12 and under; free for everyone on Fridays from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. Montclair Art Museum, South Mountain Avenue. (973) 746-5555, extension 237. MORRISTOWN ''Main Streets and Home Towns: Maps from Macculloch Hall.'' Through Jan. 14, 2007. Hours: Wednesdays, Thursdays and Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Admission: $5 to $6; free for ages 12 and under. Macculloch Hall Historical Museum, 45 Macculloch Avenue. (973) 538-2404. MORRISTOWN ''Fresh Perspectives,'' works by high school students. Through June 18. ''Echoes of the Past: Styles in Women's Costume.'' Through Sept. 10. Hours: Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays to 8 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Admission: $5 to $7; free on Thursdays from 1 to 8 p.m. Morris Museum, 6 Normandy Heights Road. (973) 971-3700. NEWARK ''Objects of Desire: 500 Years of Jewelry.'' Through Feb. 18. Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays, noon to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $3 to $7; members, free. Newark Museum, 49 Washington Street. (973) 596-6550. NEWARK ''Salute to Two Great 20th Century Artists: Picasso and Lichtenstein.'' Through June 14. ''Shopping Bags: Infinite Design Solutions for an Everyday Product.'' Through June 17. Hours: Mondays, Fridays and Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Tuesdays through Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. Public library, 5 Washington Street. (973) 733-7837. NEW BRUNSWICK ''Balazs Szabo: Fantastic Realist -- A Retrospective of Paintings and Works on Paper.'' Through Oct. 1. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Donation: $5. Museum of the American Hungarian Foundation, 300 Somerset Street. (732) 846-5777. NEW BRUNSWICK ''Japonisme: Selections From the Collection.'' ''Selections From the Henderson Collection of American Stained Glass Design.'' ''Individuals: Selections From the Dodge Collection.'' All ongoing. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Admission: $3; members, free. Jane Voorhees Zimmerli Art Museum, Rutgers University, Hamilton and George Streets. (732) 932-7237. NEW MILFORD National juried show. Through May 28. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Art Center of Northern New Jersey, 250 Center Street. (201) 599-2992. PARAMUS ''Diving Into Digital,'' digital print group show. Through June 1. Hours: Tuesdays through Thursdays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Regular admission: $3 to $5; members, free. Bergen Museum of Art and Science, Bergen Mall, Route 4 and Forest Avenue. (201) 291-8848. PRINCETON ''World War II Sketches and Other Works,'' works by Sergio Bonotto. Through June 2. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 2:30 to 6:30 p.m. Princeton Theological Seminary, Erdman Art Gallery, Center of Continuing Education, 20 Library Place. (609) 497-7990. PRINCETON ''Andy Warhol: Electric Chair.'' Through June 25. ''Death by Design: European Prints from the Fifteenth through the Twentieth Centuries.'' Through June 25. ''Mir Iskusstva: Russia's Age of Elegance.'' Through June 11. ''Worldly Guardians of the Buddhist Law,'' works celebrating the teachings of Wen C. Fong, professor emeritus. Through July 9. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Princeton University Art Museum, Nassau and Witherspoon Streets. (609) 258-3788. PRINCETON TOWNSHIP ''The Windmill Turns Slowly: Photographs of the Updike Farm,'' and ''U. S. Presidents: Famous Faces in Princeton Places.'' Through summer 2006. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Donation. Historical Society, Quaker Road. (609) 921-6748. RED BANK ''Children's Book Art With an 'Animated' Twist.'' Through May 20. Hours: Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Cel-Ebration Gallery, 30 Monmouth Street. (732) 842-8489. RIDGEWOOD ''Get Real!'' Paintings by Jon R. Friedman, David Lee and others. Through May 20. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Kerygma Gallery, 38 Oak Street. (201) 444-5510. ROOSEVELT ''Dan Hodgkinson -- a Man Abstract,'' paintings. Through May 13. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Eleanor Gallery, Historic Factory, off Route 571, Oscar Drive and North Valley Road. (609) 918-1233. ROSELAND Oils and acrylics by Joe Lugara. Through Friday. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Automatic Data Processing, A. D. P. Boulevard. (973) 994-5000. SOUTH ORANGE ''Therese Mitchell -- Photographs of New York in the 1930's and 40's Illuminated by the Writing of Joseph Mitchell.'' Wednesday through July 14. Reception: May 13, 5 to 7 p.m. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 10:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Walsh Library Gallery, Seton Hall University, 400 South Orange Avenue. (973) 275-2033. SUMMIT ''Among the Trees,'' works by Michele Brody, Heiko Blankenstein and others. Through June 4. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 9:30 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Visual Arts Center of New Jersey, 68 Elm Street. (908) 273-9121. TEANECK ''Color in Motion,'' abstract paintings by Cassandra Jennings Hall. Through May 19. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 8 a.m. to 11 p.m.; Fridays, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 10 p.m. Weiner Library, Fairleigh Dickinson University, River Road. (201) 692-2608. TRENTON ''Ellarslie Open XXIV: The Best of the Best,'' mixed-media works. Through June 11. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Donation. Trenton City Museum at the Ellarslie Mansion, 319 East State Street. (609) 989-3632. UNION ''Portraits: Sculpture and Drawings,'' works by George Segal. Through June 15. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 11 a.m. to 7 p.m.; Fridays to 3 p.m. Kean University, Center for Academic Success Gallery, 1000 Morris Avenue. (908) 737-4407. UNION Works by students receiving an M. A. in fine arts education. Through Friday. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. and 5 p.m. to 7 p.m. Kean University, James Howe Gallery, Vaughn-Eames Hall, 1000 Morris Avenue. (908) 737-4411. WALL TOWNSHIP Photographs by Robert Klein. Through June 3. Hours: Mondays, 10 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Fridays, 1 to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monmouth County Library, 2700 Allaire Road. (732) 449-8877. WEST CALDWELL Pottery by Karen Aumann and paintings by Tom Rogers. May 13 through June 30. Reception: May 13, noon to 3 p.m. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. and 2 to 4 p.m. Bouzard-Hui Gallery, 697 Bloomfield Avenue. (973) 403-7731. WHIPPANY Juried art show and sale. May 14 through June 11. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 10 p.m.; Fridays, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Gaelen Gallery, J. C. C. Metrowest, Aidekman Family Campus, 901 Route 10. (908) 530-3413.
FILM

MANALAPAN ''Random Harvest,'' directed by Mervyn LeRoy. Tuesday at 2 p.m. Free. Monmouth County Library, 125 Symmes Drive. (732) 431-7222. MARLBORO ''The Lady Eve,'' directed by Preston Sturges. Thursday at 2 p.m. Monmouth County Library, 1 Library Court at Wyncrest Drive. (732) 536-9406. RIDGEWOOD ''Thirst,'' documentary by Alan Snitow about water control and safety issues. Friday at 7:30 p.m. Donation: $5. Unitarian Society, 113 Cottage Place. (201) 444-6225. WALL TOWNSHIP ''Dial M For Murder'' directed by Alfred Hitchcock. Tuesday at 2 p.m. Free. Monmouth County Library, 2700 Allaire Road. (732) 449-8877.
COMEDY
MAHWAH ''The Best of Second City,'' sketch and improvisation. May 13 at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15 to $25. Ramapo College, Sharp Theater, 505 Ramapo Valley Road. (201) 684-7844.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items should be submitted by mail at least three weeks in advance to New Jersey Cultural Calendar, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
THEATER

CHATHAM ''Pippin,'' by Stephen Schwartz. Through May 20. Tickets: $18 and $25. Chatham Community Players, 23 North Passaic Avenue. (973) 635-7363. CINNAMINSON ''Into the Woods,'' by Stephen Sondheim; Burlington County Footlighters. Through May 20. Tickets: $15. The Playhouse, 808 Pomona Road. (856) 829-7144. FREEHOLD ''Men Are Dogs,'' by Joe Simonelli. Through June 11. Tickets: $22 and $24. Center Playhouse, 35 South Street. (732) 462-9093. MAPLEWOOD ''The Tale of the Allergist's Wife,'' comedy by Charles Busch; the Strollers. Friday through May 19. Tickets: $13 and $16. Burgdorff Cultural Center, 10 Durand Road. (973) 761-8453. MILLBURN ''Midsummer Night's Dream.'' Through May 21. $19 to $68. Paper Mill Playhouse, Brookside Drive. (973) 376-4343. MONTCLAIR ''Pinocchio,'' Running Rabbit Family Theater. Through May 26. Tickets: $14. Luna Stage, 695 Bloomfield Avenue. (973) 744-3309. NEW BRUNSWICK ''The Will Rogers Follies,'' musical by Cy Coleman, Peter Stone, Betty Comden and Adolph Green. Friday and May 13. Tickets: $30 to $55. State Theater, 15 Livingston Avenue. (732) 246-7469. ORADELL ''Proof,'' by David Auburn; Bergen County Players. Through May 27. Tickets: $15. Little Firehouse Theater, 298 Kinderkamack Road. (201) 261-4200. PRINCETON ''Ridiculous Fraud,'' comedy by Beth Henley. Friday through June 11. Tickets: $35 to $48. McCarter Theater Center, 91 University Place. (609) 258-2787. RANDOLPH ''The Heidi Chronicles'' by Wendy Wasserstein. Through May 13. Tickets: $12 and $15. Brundage Park Playhouse, Carrell Road. (973) 989-7092. RED BANK ''What the Butler Saw,'' farce by Joe Orton. Thursday through May 28. Tickets: $25 to $45. Two River Theater, 21 Bridge Avenue. (732) 345-1400.
